Package com.flag4j.linalg.decompositions

Class ComplexSchurDecomposition

java.lang.Object
com.flag4j.linalg.decompositions.SchurDecomposition<CMatrix,​CVector>
com.flag4j.linalg.decompositions.ComplexSchurDecomposition
All Implemented Interfaces:
Decomposition<CMatrix>
public class ComplexSchurDecomposition extends SchurDecomposition<CMatrix,​CVector>

This class computes the Schur decomposition of a square matrix. That is, decompose a square matrix A into A=QUQ<sup>H</sup> where Q is a unitary matrix whose columns are the eigenvectors of A and U is an upper triangular matrix in Schur form whose diagonal entries are the eigenvalues of A, corresponding to the columns of Q, repeated per their multiplicity.

Note, even if a matrix has only real entries, both Q and U may contain complex values.

    • ComplexSchurDecomposition

      public ComplexSchurDecomposition​(boolean computeU)
      Creates a decomposer to compute the Schur decomposition.
      Parameters:
      computeU - A flag which indicates if the unitary matrix Q should be computed.
      - If true, the Q matrix will be computed. - If false, the Q matrix will not be computed. If it is not needed, this may provide a performance improvement.

  • Method Details

    • decompose

      public ComplexSchurDecomposition decompose​(CMatrix src)

      Computes the Schur decomposition for a real dense square matrix. That is, decompose a square matrix A into A=QUQ<sup>H</sup> where Q is a unitary matrix whose columns are the eigenvectors of A and U is an upper triangular matrix in Schur form whose diagonal entries are the eigenvalues of A, corresponding to the columns of Q, repeated per their multiplicity.

      Note, even if a matrix has only real entries, both Q and U may contain complex values.

      Parameters:
      src - The source matrix to compute the Schur decomposition of.
      Returns:
      A reference to this decomposer.

    • shiftedImplicitQR

      protected void shiftedImplicitQR​(CMatrix H)
      Computes the Schur decomposition of a matrix using Francis' double shift algorithm (i.e. The implicit double shifted QR algorithm).
      Specified by:
      shiftedImplicitQR in class SchurDecomposition<CMatrix,​CVector>
      Parameters:
      H - The matrix to compute the Schur decomposition of. Assumed to be in upper Hessenburg form.

    • getWilkinsonShift

      private CNumber getWilkinsonShift()
      Computes the Wilkinson shift for a complex matrix. That is, the eigenvalue of the lower left 2x2 sub matrix which is closest in magnitude to the lower left entry of the matrix.
      Returns:
      The Wilkinson shift for the src matrix.

    • applyDoubleShift

      Applies an implicit double shift QR iteration using the generalized Rayleigh quotient shift

    • applySingleShift

    • applyExceptionalShift

      protected void applyExceptionalShift​(int m)
      Applies a single shift implicit QR iterations with a random shift.
      Parameters:
      m - Lower right index of the sub-matrix currently being worked on.

    • applyTransforms

      protected void applyTransforms​(CMatrix ref)
      Applies unitary transformations and creates a bulge in the T matrix of the Schur decomposition.
      Parameters:
      ref - The unitary transformation to apply.

    • chaseBulge

      protected void chaseBulge()
      Chases the bulge from the T matrix introduced by the unitary transformations and returns T to upper Hessenburg form.

    • getExceptionalShift

      protected CNumber getExceptionalShift​(int m)
      Constructs a shift in a random direction which is of the same magnitude as the elements in the SchurDecomposition.T matrix.
      Parameters:
      m - Lower right index of the sub-matrix currently being worked on.
      Returns:
      A shift in a random direction which is of the same magnitude as the elements in the SchurDecomposition.T matrix.
